required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Regional Anesthesia Practice in Greece and Depiction of the Effect of Educational Activities in This Respect

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this structured questionnaire is to provide useful insight on the practice of regional anesthesia in Greece and depict the result of educational efforts taking place in the country to expand the knowledge and practice of regional anesthesia in the country

primary_outcome.measure: knowledge and practice of regional anesthesia techniques
primary_outcome.description: this is a 36-item free-text questionnaire, aiming at assessing knowledge and practice of regional anesthesia amongst participants

arm_group.description: this group consists of anesthesiologists that have attended a Regional Anesthesia Seminar taking place once a year

arm_group.arm_group_label: no participation in Regional Anesthesia Seminar
arm_group.description: this group consists of anesthesiologists that have not attended a Regional Anesthesia Seminar taking place once a year

intervention.description: this group of anesthesiologists attended the Regional Anesthesia Seminar

intervention.intervention_name: no participation in Regional Anesthesia Seminar
intervention.description: this group of anesthesiologists did not attend the Regional Anesthesia Seminar
intervention.arm_group_label: no participation in Regional Anesthesia Seminar

study_pop.textblock: the polulation will be anesthesiologists practicing in Greece

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- greek anesthesia practitioners
Exclusion Criteria:
- nurses
- operating department assistants
- surgeons

reference.citation: Huang J, Gao H. Regional anesthesia practice in China: a survey. J Clin Anesth. 2016 Nov;34:115-23. doi: 10.1016/j.jclinane.2016.03.071. Epub 2016 May 3.

Smith MP, Sprung J, Zura A, Mascha E, Tetzlaff JE. A survey of exposure to regional anesthesia techniques in American anesthesia residency training programs. Reg Anesth Pain Med. 1999 Jan-Feb;24(1):11-6.
